intro: Dimeria, commonly known as the desert daisy, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Acanthaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. Dimeria species are typically low-growing shrubs or herbs, adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments. They play an important role in desert ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and stabilizing sandy soils.
